div.head: Summary
div.p: The United States recognized the Philippines in 1946.

div.head: U.S. Recognition of Philippine Independence, 1946.
div.p: The United States recognized the Republic of the Philippines as an independent state on July 4, 1946, when President Harry S. Truman did so in a proclamation. The United States and the Philippines signed a treaty on the same date whereby the United States renounced all claims to the Philippines, which had previously been under American sovereignty.

div.head: Establishment of Diplomatic Relations and the American Embassy in the Philippines, 1946.
div.p: Diplomatic relations were established on July 4, 1946, when American Ambassador Paul V. McNutt presented his credentials.
